subject: RE: [junit] How to invoke junit from Swing application?
msgSnippet: Runtime s exec(...) returns a Process instance. With getInputStream() you can read the output of the Process, write it to System.out to see what is (not)
messageBody:
Runtime's exec(...) returns a Process instance. With getInputStream() you
can read the output of the Process, write it to System.out to see what is
(not) happening. Maybe a classpath problem ?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Drobat [mailto:junitnews@...]
> Sent: vrijdag 30 augustus 2002 11:27
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] How to invoke junit from Swing application?
>
>
> I try to invoke junit from Swing application; I did the
> following but it
> didn't work. If it is console application, it is working
> fine. Any ideas??
> Thanks!
>
> public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt)
> { ...
> if (source == junitItem)
> runJunit();
> ...
> }
>
> public void runJunit()
> {
> try
> {
> Runtime.getRuntime().exec("java "+ "junit.awtui.TestRunner
> junittest.TestTest1");
> }
> catch(IOException e)
> {
> System.out.println(e);
> }
> }
>
>
